AdditionalFields.Value: Chemistry,Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science

Description: The interface between the quantitative sciences (mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics,chemistry, engineering) and cancer research has never been as salient as it is in the present, due to the ongoingmarathon effort towards personalized medicine based on the big data revolution in biomedical sciences andsimultaneous advances in computational power and methodological sophistication.This symposium will focus on the state of the art research at the interface of computational and quantitativesciences and cancer research at different levels of organization --- from drug discovery (atomic level) to molecular(genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics) to organismal (personalized medicine and clinical trials). There will bea panel discussion at the end of the session focused on elucidating the challenges in the field and approaches tosolve them. Thus, the overarching goal of the symposium will be to foster interdisciplinary research andcollaborations across the many distinct yet overlapping quantitative aspects of cancer research.
SearchResultBody: SY30. Advances in Quantitative Sciences in Cancer: From Atomic Scale to Patients
Title: Advances in Quantitative Sciences in Cancer: From Atomic Scale to Patients
